body: It looks to me like this is just a Python failure. I'm not really sure what happened here, but it doesn't look like it was caused by installing the Node library first.
@lesv: how reproducible is this? Are you able to reproduce it without the node installation first? Are you able to "pip install grpcio"?

I haven't had a chance to go back to it, but I tried what you asked:


I am facing the same problem. Seem the grpcio on pypi is tagged as pre-release which will not install by pip in default setting. I run the following command and install successfully.

`pip install grpcio --pre`

That change didn't help me.

    #include <grpc/grpc.h>

    1 error generated.

    Complete output from command /usr/bin/python -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/private/var/folders/00/113l8000h01000cxqpysvccm0044fd/T/pip_build_lesv/grpcio/setup.py';exec(compile(getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(**file**).read().replace('\r\n', '\n'), **file**, 'exec'))" install --record /var/folders/00/113l8000h01000cxqpysvccm0044fd/T/pip-HnAw65-record/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile:
    running install

running build
Remilestoning - we'd like to support gRPC-Python-on-MacOS shortly after Beta and long before General Availability but aren't considering it a hard Beta requirement.
Is this an active issue? And if the scope of this issue is only "support gRPC Python on MacOS", should it be deduplicated?
I'd certainly like to see gRPC Python on MacOS.  @jgeewax may wish to comment.

I believe that my earlier question should be answered before we continue looking at this. The error, following the `--pre` flag fix (which is a requirement given the known behavior of `pip` _until_ we're out of beta), is a missing include. This means the user's environment is broken w.r.t. what the Python package expects. If the dummy file cannot compile either, then the problem is either with the upstream grpc core package installation or with how `pip install` is invoked to work around include-path idiosyncrasies. If it _can_ compile, then we have a... err... more _fun_ problem.
This is either a duplicate or dead. Feel free to re-open if I'm wrong!

```

```


```
cc -bundle -undefined dynamic_lookup -arch x86_64 -arch i386 -Wl,-F. build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/module.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/types.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/utility.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/types/client_credentials.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/types/server_credentials.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/types/completion_queue.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/types/call.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/types/channel.o build/temp.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c/types/server.o -lgrpc -lgpr -o build/lib.macosx-10.11-intel-2.7/grpc/_adapter/_c.so
```
